segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 35
16. Nandikkhayavagga
164. Koṭṭhikaanattasutta
Ekamantaṃ … pe …
vihareyyanti.
“Yo kho, koṭṭhika, anattā tatra te chando pahātabbo.
segments.en: “Koṭṭhita, you should give up desire for what is not-self.

segments.pli: Ko ca, koṭṭhika, anattā?
Cakkhu kho, koṭṭhika, anattā; tatra te chando pahātabbo.
Rūpā anattā; tatra te chando pahātabbo.
Cakkhuviññāṇaṃ anattā; tatra te chando pahātabbo.
Cakkhusamphasso anattā; tatra te chando pahātabbo.
segments.en: and eye contact are not-self: you should give up desire for them.

segments.pli: Yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi anattā; tatra te chando pahātabbo … pe …
segments.en: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact is also not-self: You should give up desire for it.

segments.pli: jivhā anattā; tatra te chando pahātabbo … pe …
mano anattā; tatra te chando pahātabbo.
Dhammā anattā; tatra te chando pahātabbo.
Manoviññāṇaṃ …
manosamphasso …
yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi anattā; tatra te chando pahātabbo.
segments.en: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact is also not-self: you should give up desire for it.

segments.pli: Yo kho, koṭṭhika, anattā, tatra te chando pahātabbo”ti.
segments.en: Koṭṭhita, you should give up desire for what is not-self.”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Mahākoṭṭhita asks for a teaching to take on retreat. The Buddha says to give up desire for what is not-self, i.e. the process of sense experience.
